front: Match the following networking terms related to protocol suites with their descriptions:
back:
Protocol Suite → A group of inter-related protocols necessary to perform a communication function comprehensively.
Protocol Stack → Shows how individual protocols within a suite are implemented, viewed in layers.
TCP/IP → The most common protocol suite used today, an open standard maintained by IETF.
OSI Protocols → A family of protocols including a seven-layer model, largely replaced by TCP/IP.

pairs.right: A group of inter-related protocols necessary to perform a communication function comprehensively.
Shows how individual protocols within a suite are implemented, viewed in layers.
The most common protocol suite used today, an open standard maintained by IETF.
A family of protocols including a seven-layer model, largely replaced by TCP/IP.

front: Match the following application layer protocols with their primary function:
back:
DNS → Translates domain names, such as cisco.com, into corresponding IP addresses for network communication.
DHCPv4 → Dynamically assigns IPv4 addressing information to DHCPv4 clients at startup, enabling address reuse.
SMTP → Enables clients to send email to a mail server and servers to send email.
FTP → Enables users to access and transfer files between hosts over a network reliably.
